website_summaries.verdict: A video doorbell that balances price with functionality.
pros: Takes sharp, clear video and responds well to motion once sensitivity is correctly adjusted
cons: Occasionally has problems with connectivity due to proximity to WiFi

website_summaries.verdict: This Ring model is an improvement in terms of signal range and versatility. Great video imagery, sensitive motion detection, and room to expand with add-ons and upgrades.
pros: 1080HD video definition, sharp images for recording
Combines real ringers/chimes with virtual smartphone "ringers."
Room for upgrades, such as floodlights
cons: Some concerns about the WiFi signal boost claims
Sensitive motion detector can send multiple false positives

website_summaries.verdict: Sharp images and easy installation make this Ring doorbell camera an ideal option for anyone wanting an upgrade from its predecessor.
pros: A mid-range, upgraded Ring doorbell with more vivid image resolution quality than the first gen model
Price is on the middle of the spectrum compared to similar Ring models
cons: Some lag time in the motion sensor has been noted

website_summaries.verdict: Look no further than Ring's battery-powered Video Doorbell 2 if you don't want to deal with electrical wiring.
pros: The Ring Video Doorbell 2's removable lithium ion battery makes it easy to install -- and even easier to charge
It works with Alexa via the Amazon Echo Show
cons: You have to sign up for Ring's optional fee-based cloud storage service to save and review past video clips
The large Video Doorbell 2 won't fit on most doorframes

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch fine print.
customer_reviews.text: Typical bait and switch fine print, "free" 30 day subscription worked fine, but now even trying to answer an active ring takes too long an it turns into a "past" event, subscription renewal required. For what this thing costs you should be able to at least answer an active alert within 30 seconds without it drifting off to the cloud and not being able to view it at all ... dont waste your money ... unless you want another monthly bill to pay.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Zinkosky

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The doorbell works well, with some delay with loading the video and providing notifications. Had to charge the battery about every 3 weeks.. Which is annoying because you don't have a functioning doorbell during this time. I wish ring provided an extra battery with this model, as it was about 80$ more than the first model when I purchased it. With the only other upgrade being 1080p video, which isn't much different than 720p. Also in order to view any saved video captured from motion, you have to pay $30 a year. So factor that into your cost... Edit: with good signal strength and 65% battery it is unable to load live view...
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie W

customer_reviews.title: Beware:  Company & Products are both very Disappointing..
customer_reviews.text: Beware: Company & Products are both very Disappointing... First unit [RING 2] I received early October '17 was DOA - Replacement unit has had intermittent problems from first week installed. Camera failed completely in November 2017; unit transmits Video that is recorded as just Black/ with Noise! Still fighting with RING to get a replacement – No Success; dozens of emails with most going Unanswered. When I did get a response its NOT from Tech Support or Customer Service or Product Management ~~ it's from a Social Media Community something person that is totally clueless. The RING Chime also is intermittent. I don't know how RING stays in business! -LJ
customer_reviews.author: LJ Bujak

customer_reviews.title: Ring Doorbell
customer_reviews.text: Update! See attached video catching delivery person delivering my pkg and then stealing it! I received the Ring doorbell and am very happy with it. It was easy to connect to my wifi and very easy to install. The directions are clear and simple, the best I've seen on a product like this. I downloaded the Ring app on my phone and was immediately able to see video of my front door and communicate with those outside. The range is wide and very clear with sound and color. Awesome product, get it!
customer_reviews.author: Carol H.

customer_reviews.title: Not something I would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: 30 feet and one hollow wooden wall between router wifi and the door, the audio is completely unintelligible and video breaks up. Two Nest cameras even further away and multiple walls and floor, stream video HD quality. Linking with either laptop or cell phone app is slow and hit-or-miss. Wish I had returned this 4 days ago when I still could. The battery inside does not charge from the 12v transformer that drives the original door bell, you have to take it out and charge it ike a cell phone. Hard to do from 3 hours drive away. Motion detector works, but by the time I can get the app to link, the person has long gone. argh.
customer_reviews.author: TexARC, aka A.Ron Carmichael

customer_reviews.title: Even I could install it !!!
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble starting up a computer but the Ring Doorbell 2 was so simple even I was able to install. You can't beat the $30 bucks a YEAR for the cloud. While do not have to have it, it's crazy not to get it. You get quality at a great price. Everything that you need is in the box except for a drill. Simple easy to follow instructions. Customer service is quick to answer the phone and supply answers to questions and is NOT out-sourced over seas. You will be happy with well thought out unit.
customer_reviews.author: Nick A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, no wires needed.
customer_reviews.text: I love this doorbell. I added the chime for indoor sound too, making this system even better. I prefer the battery option since I do not have a wired doorbell to attach the Pro model to. The fact that it comes with all of the extra pieces to tailor the setup to your particular scenario is great. Set up was unbelievably easy. The battery does take a while to charge, I left mine over night. So far it is working great.
customer_reviews.author: HFL

customer_reviews.title: Warning after your free trial ends you can't see your front door anymore
customer_reviews.text: so if you don't pay for their plan you can't see your front door anymore, i loved the 1st month you could see everything clear , but now i'm out 200 bucks for a video door bell i can't use anymore, no where in the page you look at all the info does it say your going to be held hostage after the free trial
customer_reviews.author: ChickyTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: Privacy Concerns
customer_reviews.text: Giving local police department's access without permission of owner is a major problem. Consumer's should be warned before buying this product. I was looking forward to having this technology until I found out it allows police to spy on people. I'll be returning my Ring Video Doorbell 2 because of police having access. The "justice" system is beyond corrupt this technology should be used for personal security not police surveillance. If I wanted them watching I'd buy products that advertise police having access without my permission or the ability to block them. The neighbors feature is great without police. They ruin this product it is mass surveillance.
customer_reviews.author: Rick sluder

customer_reviews.title: Why can't they provide a simple contact closure??????
customer_reviews.text: I hate it, but that may be my fault. Turns out I have an intercom system instead of a standard doorbell. So my existing can't be used to power this unit. OK. No problem. Having to go with battery operation and recharging isn't the end of the world. BUT why can't they provide a simple contact closure so I can tie that to the push-button of my existing system. I have "chimes" all over the house, and don't want to purchase all that many of their new remote ringers. All it would take is for this new unit to activate the old button. That's not expecting too much. But apparently it is....
customer_reviews.author: Richard MackenzieTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: RING Support Will Help You
customer_reviews.text: After my first review (which wasn't good), I thought I should write another. After contacting the RING support several times (too many to count), they've finally worked with me and my RING. Support and I are doing what we can to get RING working properly. As of this date 11/17/18 my RING is working well. It has at one point caught a prospective intruder early in the whee hours one morning headed towards the side of my house and for that capture, I must say it's working. I've had some minor issues with it now and then ; but when RING is working...it's a chime.
customer_reviews.author: Sista P

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: it require subscription plan, otherwise, the motion is not recorded
customer_reviews.author: "frank888"

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but the device itself fails to deliver
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, but the device itself fails to deliver. Specifically, the motion sensor is inconsistent. It triggers when a car is passing by, yet it periodically fails to trigger when someone is approaching my house. The recording would show a person walking away from my house, but it didn't start recording the approach. Very disappointing. Also, the video quality is fairly poor. The device itself feels very cheap. Finally, the mounting is poorly designed. There are no mounting holes at the top of the device, which creates a small gap between the wall and the ring doorbell. It looks bad, and make is fairly easy for someone to just rip the device out.
customer_reviews.author: Customer8284

customer_reviews.title: Awesome doorbell
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this ring. I had a hard time installing it so I called Ring and they hooked me up with HelloTech which is a company that sends out installers. The installation took $50 and 45 min. Now this little doorbell tells me whenever there is motion at the door. I can answer the door from wherever! I love how it came with a bronze faceplate since my door handles are also bronze.
customer_reviews.author: Yuna Park

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Speaker is horrible and cannot hear well. You have to have great connection to be able to answer or view. You also have to subscribe to a monthly fee service. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dezz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. When I attempt to check in with my phone most of the time the camera will not display it continues to loop as if it’s trying to turn on. When you finally get the view the person would be gone. Great concept but it does not work well.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Best internet and WiFi still bad connection
customer_reviews.text: Horrible software and WiFi antenna. Nothing but poor connection. Ring customer service is useless. Excuse after excuse. Kept blaming my internet connection. No other device indoor or out door has this problem. Only the ring doorbell. My connection is Fios quantum and theirs best router and it’s only 5’ from the doorbell. I even took the doorbell off the wall brought it in and put it next to the router still receiving poor signal. We went round and round so long I can’t even return it anymore. If you buy it. Good luck and beware.
customer_reviews.author: Showells

customer_reviews.title: Warning - Subscription Required!
customer_reviews.text: Although the video looks great and the audio is clear for real-time events, you must pay a subscription costing $3 a month if you want to be able to view past occurrences even for the same day. This means that if you don't have a subscription and someone steals a package or breaks in you'll be just as clueless as you would if you didn't even have this device. Factor in an added fee of at least $66 (assuming you'll own it for at least 2 years). There are equally great products available without a subscription. I give it one star because I don't like being ripped off by hidden fees.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great! But it can’t do it’s job 8/10 times. It will pick up every car driving by, but not somebody standing literally right in front of it (my son even touched the camera. Nothing). Ive adjusted the settings probably 15 times. If I bring the bar down any lower to not get the road, it won’t get anything at all. Sucks for the price. All it’s really good for is talking through it or viewing the live camera- which who is going to watch that all day?
customer_reviews.author: Christian Whitfill

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service means useless product
customer_reviews.text: Traded in my cell phone. Tried to add the Ring app to my new phone and cant. Ring customer service said while my email is on a Ring account, there's a gmail.com account listed as owning my Ring and they cant tell me the address. We have tried everything and can't get access to the doorbell. Ring said if we provided the purchase receipt they could maybe help. That was 2 months ago and they've done nothing. I have a 9 month old Ring doorbell that is useless now. Buyer beware their customer service sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Archer

customer_reviews.title: It's OK when it works
customer_reviews.text: This thing has one of the worst connections for viewing activity live. When going to connect it can sometimes take 10 seconds, or most of the time it can take 2 minutes!! The microphone is horrible too! When it actually does connect from a phone ring there is 15% chance I can actually understand what the person is saying. Definitely going to look for an alternative when I have more time to deal with things. I regret paying for the 1 year cloud service because I seriously doubt I'm going to continue using this for a full year.
customer_reviews.author: GamerGuy274

customer_reviews.title: Black screen more often than not
customer_reviews.text: Constantly doesnt connect and mostly when it does it's a black screen. My internet is 50mbps and the router was 3 feet away from the doorbell so that wasnt the problem. It did work better at night but still the recording was glitchy. The only thing that worked well was the motion sensor and the actual door bell. App seems nice but I would rather prefer a bare bones app that simply displayed the camera when clicked on. We have a $30 baby monitor that works flawlessly and puts this thing to shame. I really wanted this to work but I had to return it. Oh and the $30 yearly recording fee sucks too.
customer_reviews.author: roll cyclones

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless you’re buying the subscription.
customer_reviews.text: I would advise anybody looking at purchasing one of these that it’s great if you purchase the subscription. If you’re planning on trying without the subscription I would save your money. While not within the subscription period, the videos process for so long that any motion detected is gone before you can see the video and 9x out of 10 the video never finishes processing so you’ll never know what caused the motion. The subscription is inexpensive it’s just something to keep in mind.
customer_reviews.author: casandra

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea behind this product, but the app isn't great. In the last week, it seems to have improved (even though I don't remember getting an update), but I also bought the video storage plan (super cheap... $3/month or $30 for a year) so maybe you get better service that way? LOL. The camera quality is fantastic and now that I'm actually getting notifications, I don't have as much buyer's remorse as I did before. I still get a black screen 90% of the time when trying to do a Live View, but if there's no one at my house, what's the point of that anyway? So, I like it. A flawless app integration would make it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: H. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Not as Impressed as I'd Hoped
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be better. 1. Changing the settings is confusing...Every time a truck drives by, the motion sensor goes off. Even after narrowing the sensor range to 4 ft it still chirps. It must be the vibration that makes it activate. I disabled the motion sensor alerts. 2. Goes through batteries fast. If you can, have it hardwired if you have an existing wired doorbell. I had to buy a back-up battery. More money, of course. I like the concept of a Smart Doorbell and all, and Ring is probably the most marketed one. I wish I had done more research before I bought. I'll probably trash this and go with another brand. Disappointed, but oh well...
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Works, but without monthly fee not very useful.
customer_reviews.text: The monthly service fee to record even 24 hours of data regulates your ring to just a doorbell. You would be better off purchasing an internet camera and leaving your old doorbell in place.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle H.

customer_reviews.title: Good but has issues
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to order. Bought mainly because I don't have the required low voltage AC supply at the doorstep. Disabling motion alerts or reducing the range helps battery survive nearly a month. Cloud storage is expensive though cheaper than Nest cam. Alerts are mostly delayed and often cannot see anyone in the recorded video clip which defeats the purpose of installing this. Customer care is very good but they keep telling it is the bandwidth issue and the internet speed etc. Maybe next is 100MBPS and with ORBI Mesh router! All other demanding WiFi devices work perfectly. Ring need upgrade their servers and the response to the alerts.
customer_reviews.author: EGeekDr

customer_reviews.title: requires a paid subscription to see video
customer_reviews.text: works great... until your free subscription runs out. Thought I could view the video for a day or so but instead get a message stating your ring protect plan has expired. Need to pay a fee if you want to see any video from the motion detector or when someone rings the bell. Missed my return window by a day. Replacing with an Arlo camera that holds recording free work a week with NO FEE.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Bayne

customer_reviews.title: 2nd Ring failure for me.
customer_reviews.text: Charged it, went through set up in the evening after it was delivered, worked fine. Next morning it was still ok. Installed it on my door frame, still working fine. 2 hours later....dead, doorbell stopped responding. Removed, reinserted battery...dead, no lights, nothing. Recharged battery, put it back in...dead. Pressed setup button....no response. Held setup button 15 seconds per troubleshooting instructions...dead. My Ring Pro failed in a similar manner after about 15 months which is what prompted me to give them a second chance and buy this one. I'm done with Ring and will be spreading the word.
customer_reviews.author: M. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Poor Night Vision
customer_reviews.text: I installed this doorbell at my home in Georgia as I had installed an earlier model at my home in Florida where results have been fine. This newer model in Georgia functions with one major exception. The night vision is very poor quality. When an alert is detected after dark even at close range (less than five feet) you can see some movement but that’s about it. When I then go on Live View there is nothing you can see at all beyond about five feet. Night vision is one of the main features that I needed. This Model 2 is a total disappointment in that area.
customer_reviews.author: ENTITLED2OPINION

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I installed my ring 2 door bell this weekend. Followed the instructions and was up and running in 30 minutes including hard wiring my device. Had to call customer service only once before installation and they were great. So far my doorbell has worked as advertised the tricky part is getting the motion settings correct. My ring2 is 20 ft from the street and it picked up a number of cars passing kthe house early this morning. Cold morning so heat signature from vehicles may have tripped the sensor. Had to customize the motion sensor. I have a strong signal Rssi of -36 so getting good signal .l am please so far.
customer_reviews.author: The Shootist

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Video does not respond quickly like advertised, you cannot answer the doorbell remotely as advertised. The video constantly starts and stops does not run fluid. I tested wifi connection and signal strength and all were within Ring's recommended parameters. Tried adding a chime pro to boost signal but it did not help.
customer_reviews.author: dave2282r

customer_reviews.title: Response so slow, visitor has left before you can answer with the app....
customer_reviews.text: Several problems with the Ring doorbell. 1. Response of the camera is extremely slow. When someone is immediately at your door, the app on your phone will take forever to open and by then, the visitor at your door is gone. 2. There are no free plans to view your videos. The lack of a response time nullifies its use, then you can't go back and see who was there. Camera is almost useless.... Funny how Amazon isn't even reaching out to give the canned response "this is not what you should expect"....I'll be trying to recoup my investment soon or throw it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: DBurk

customer_reviews.title: Great security doorbell
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because after seeing the reviews. It works great and we can see when packages are delivered or when someone comes to our door. I even got notifications when I was over 1200 miles away on business. I was able to talk to the person at my door, and I didn't have internet access where I was. This was a nice feature of the Ring Doorbell. The video quality is amazing. The night vision is great. I went ahead and paid the $30/year for the subscription even though you don't have to. Installation of the Ring doorbell 2 was easy and took about 20 minutes from out of the box to getting it adjusted. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Deb S

customer_reviews.title: No instant video on echo show, buffering issues
customer_reviews.text: There are so many reviews out there comparing door bells and most reviews miss the point that most doorbells can't do a very simple thing: Press the button - a video of the door starts instantly showing who is in the front door. You have to ask Alexa to start the video. Although, again, this is common for the majority of smart doorbells, but I would expect both Ring and Blink (Amazon companies) would have this capability. Nest and Google Home have figured this out. So far, the only one I have seem proof it does, why can't Amazon?
customer_reviews.author: Geek cook

customer_reviews.title: Quik, simple, and easy to install and same for the app on phone.
customer_reviews.text: Install was quick and easy. Installing the app on my phone was the same. Being a 100% disable Veteran, I can't always jump up to answer the door, but with the Ring I don't have to worry about jumping up any more. I'm still working out some bugs like setting the motion sensors just right, but that's expected. For me, a great investment! Ira "Jake" Jakob USAF (Ret) 100% Disabled, Not Ready To Quit!
customer_reviews.author: "Jake"

customer_reviews.title: Ring doorbell v2
customer_reviews.text: Install was pretty easy. App set up was pretty easy. I have set up other security systems with aps before. Gave it a 2 star because you have to pay a monthly fee per each ring devise just to SEE and record ANY VIDEO. I did not read that at all anywhere, not that it is not stated, but i think that would be something very highly stated that you have to subscribe and pay monthly for EACH RING ITEM that you need for or to use as a security system. My other systems you do not need to pay for any thing. You can archive videos and save many videos weekly for free.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Not once has it worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: GOOD LUCK getting this to work in time to use the audio function. I've had this almost 9 months and have not once been able to get the function to work in even a remotely timely manner. And don't forget that you have to pay a monthly subscription fee for this thing to actually work as advertised (it still won't). Video rarely saves correctly, notifications are almost always too late to be relevant (most never make it my way). If I could do it again I would have absolutely gone with a different solution.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent!
customer_reviews.text: Set up was a snap! Existing doorbell made that aspect of installation easy too. Have had two incidents take place right outside my home and since I was in the back of the house I was totally unaware. The most recent involved fire trucks and the barn across the road from me burning to the ground. I do have quite good hearing but was unaware until my husband asked a neighbor about the barn and he told him about the fire and said people were out watching and would you believe passers by were actually parked in my driveway. I am able to see the whole area now at a glance. All in all very happy.
customer_reviews.author: CARROLL ASTEMBORSKI

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money. You have to purchase a plan in order for this to be operable. After the free trial expires, you cant view video of any activity at your front door unless you have paid the monthly/annual fee. DO NOT BUY. You will also need to purchase the Ring Chime in order to hear when someone rings your bell. Total Scam.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I guess just read the review
customer_reviews.text: Parden the view. I know I'm not the richest person nd don't have the nicest looking house or yard on the block , but I don't care I just wanted you guys to see how good the picture is on this video doorbell. I love to write honest reviews and I 100% reccomend buying this. Mine has no lag, and was very easy to set up and get going. Oh BTW I set it up myself and trust me I'm no professional.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Frustration with Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item along with a free accompanying Echo Dot. The Ring arrived, but without the Echo. When I inquired, the Amazon employee informed me that I had neglected to check the box stating I wanted the Echo. I am sure there was a box, but I didn't see it - and I saw no instructions stating that another measure was required to receive the Echo. I was unpleasantly surprised at Amazon's intransigence in this matter and am disinclined to renew my Prime membership as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Ted Hallman

customer_reviews.title: Ring fried my doorbell, but they responded quickly
customer_reviews.text: 5 months after purchase and install, we smelled something hot in the house like melting plastic, and turns out the ring door bell shorted the actual doorbell unit that makes noise in our foyer. Luckily someone was home to pull it off the wall and disconnect the ring doorbell. Maybe it's defective? The first 5 months of use were ok other than that but risking a fire hazard doesn't make me feel very safe. Update: I contacted Ring and they were very quick to respond and resolve the issue; and easy to work with.
customer_reviews.author: BSlaw

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of money. For the amount of money this costs you would think it would be a solid product. Not so. This just quits working randomly. The app shows the battery to be charged but the doorbell will not detect motion or even signal the phone when someone rings. A call to tech support and their solution was to uninstall and reinstall the app. That was a 45 minute call. Then a few days later it stops working again. I hit the reset button to see if I could get it to work. Setup failed. Very frustrating to buy an expensive product and it is just garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it records, sometimes it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: It works fine as a doorbell, never missed someone ringing the bell. I have the recording plan with Amazon, sometimes it records, sometimes it doesn't .... the signal is good, I have no idea why it sometimes decides to do it, and sometimes it doesn't. Also sometimes it starts recording when someone is already leaving my door, so the beginning is missing in the recording. I expected more. I do get the alerts on my phone when it feels like sending them.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: It won't work and I can't return it.
customer_reviews.text: It is not compatible with an analog doorbell. That means if you don't have your cell phone with you, you will not know someone is at the door. It also requires DC power and the power supply it came with doesn't meet building codes. I purchased this as a Christmas gift and now I see the window to return it closed Dec 24. Naturally, it was opened on the 25th. I guess I'll have to sell it on eBay at a loss.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Cross

customer_reviews.title: Removable battery is a huge plus!
customer_reviews.text: Love Ring in general, but the 2 is way better than the original! This has better camera quality, and the removable battery is so much easier to handle. We bought a second battery so we can just switch them out quickly. Our old Ring had to be ripped off the door frame because the screws were stripped from taking it on and off to charge and there was no other way to get it off. Plus, while we were charging it for several hours before, we had no camera and no doorbell. No bueno! This is SO much better!
customer_reviews.author: Melrstx

customer_reviews.title: Who is at the front door
customer_reviews.text: After watching the videos, it was easy to install. I'm 80, so it wasn't perfectly parallel, but close enough. Like to kow who is approching and maybe at my door, as does my wife, and this does that. Great item along with this is the Amazon dot which also tells you when someone is there. Video is okay but would like the response time to be shorter to get the messages and video since my WiFIi is quite fast. Maybe an update will fix that. Other than that, I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Cyclone3211

customer_reviews.title: Just awful
customer_reviews.text: The motion doesn’t activate until a couple minutes after the motion activity has already passed, and the recording didn’t even catch the guy who took a package off my porch until he was already back on the sidewalk walking away. The doorbell worked decently well until the free subscription (that’s in the fine print and you don’t realize is a paid service until it’s over and you call for support on why your doorbell stopped working) ended. Bottom line, NOT WORTH THE MONEY or hassle. Honestly, not even worth the hassle even if it were free.
customer_reviews.author: Shyma

customer_reviews.title: Consistently disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The concept for this product is great... All the bells and whistle’s might look great on paper, but if you can’t actually connect to the device to trigger a “live view” it becomes useless. That’s like buying a phone that has all these bells and whistle‘s... you can check your email, surf the web, etc... but you cannot make any calls. As far as usability, the company has no business creating any new products, nor adding any new features, until the purpose of this device is fulfilled as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Chasman

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: It takes a long time to show the video, it often doesn’t ring though and notify that there is someone at the door. It only picks up motion half the time. Night vision is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Only Worked for 1 Month- Would Not Connect to WiFi After That
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Ring Video Doorbell 2 after much research and reading reviews. It worked great for the first few weeks, then lost Internet connection. Had to reset following Ring App instructions. Took many tries, but eventually reconnected. Worked for about another week then unable to connect. Called Ring, went through all of the troubleshooting again, testing our router (which works fine with every other device in the house), resetting the device, etc. No Luck. We acutally have a WiFi extender right above the front door. Also have the Ring alarm system which has no problem connecting to our network. This doorbell is a dud. Need to return but Amazon is saying we are outside the return window...
customer_reviews.author: ralgiers

customer_reviews.title: I'M DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ring doorbell in June and had it installed around August. As of November 21st, it is malfunctioning. Sometimes it picks up front door activity and sometimes it doesn't. I'm unhappy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: ALT

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Useless, buggy piece of junk. Of the 3 security devices connected to my home WiFi, this is the only brand item of 3 that fails to connect to live view on a regular basis. For $25 and a micro SD card you can buy a very popular alternative that retains video for zero additional cost.
customer_reviews.author: Brown Trout

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy, IT'S DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: I've had this doorbell for about a month now and it has all of a sudden just stopped working saying something about a validation certificate failure? UPDATE: THE DAMN THING IS SO HOT IT IS ACTUALLY MELTING. I contacted Ring support and they are suppose to have someone contacting me shortly. Even though they know I'm afraid of the doorbell bursting into flames, I have been told not to touch it until someone gets here. I'm glad I paid the extra and had this professionally installed so no blame here. I wish this would allow me to post a photo, it's ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: susan sakio

customer_reviews.title: It does not work like a intercom with echo dot 3 or any home intercome
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Ring doorbell 2 combo with Echo dot 3 from amazon, imagining that it will work together and I bought one more Echo dot 3 for my bed room so I could eliminate my old home intercom and use the Echo Dot 3 to talk back to who is at the door. Amazon and Ring should not sell combos that don’t work together. It can only alert you if someone is at the door or passing by, but you can't talk to the person like an intercom. You need a Echo Spot or ECHO Show. and you can't conect it to your existining intercom.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with Alexa integration
customer_reviews.text: Used the Alexa Dot to chime for the front door. Obviously you need to be semi tech-savvy to set them up together. Need to have both ring app, and the Alexa app. For some reason the integration doesn't work from the PC alexa set up in your browser, you must use the Alexa app, once ring skill is enabled, you can go into the Devices under "smarthome" and there is a little switch you need to turn on for the Ring Chime for the doorbell. The ring itself was very easy to install, takes maybe 10 min to install.
customer_reviews.author: IAN B GIJSBERS

customer_reviews.title: Internet signal strength
customer_reviews.text: The star rating is only because it won’t let me review without it. There was nothing wrong with it, it was an issue on my end. I looked forward to having the doorbell installed but then was extremely disappointed, I have to send it back. My internet signal in my home is too weak for images to download. We tested it but images would never load to see who was at the door. I live in somewhat of a rural town so before you decide on purchasing the ring doorbell, make sure your internet signal strength is strong enough to support it so you too are not disappointed when it won’t work.
customer_reviews.author: KASE

customer_reviews.title: The product works fine. Good clarity have the notifications are ok (a ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned it after 30 minutes out of the packaging. The product works fine. Good clarity have the notifications are ok (a little slow). The reason I bought it was to tie into my home security system (self built). I have 6 cameras around the house and wanted one at the door facing straight out. It does the job, but you have to pay for their service if you want to save the videos. If this product let you integrate it with other storage solutions, I'd buy 3 in a heartbeat. Because they locked it down to only use with their system, it went back the day I got it. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation! Ring is better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I had a need -- better visibility of who is at my door. A camera seemed like the best option. However, most surveillance systems are rather pricey. I saw the Ring some time ago and thought it would serve my purpose. Well, I was correct. Not only was the price reasonable, but the installation was pretty straightforward as well. The kit comes with pretty much everything you may need in order to install it. Using it has also been a breeze; pretty intuitive. I've just had it a few days, but so far, I love it. Thank you again!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Best Item for Twarting Poor Delivery and Package Pirates
customer_reviews.text: After having multiple packages delivered to another house, and said packages disappearing... I was done going rounds with delivery/postal services and their less than stellar customer service. The Ring Video Doorbell was my magic bullet. The motion sensor is able to detect movement all the way out to mail mailbox. I see every delivery, trash pick up, and lawn service visit that happens. Beyond that, there is no arguing on whether or not a driver has delivered a package when you show the supervisor your activity list for the day and magically their driver isn't there. Take a stand versus package theft and irresponsibility and buy one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Cater Tater

customer_reviews.title: Look for a better option
customer_reviews.text: What ever. That is how I feel. Not impressed. Bought this a couple of years ago. Wanted to work out any kinks. Would not again buy. We get the notice anywhere from 20 minutes to two hours later when someone has been to the door. Upgrading the wifi didn't help. When we upgraded our phones, they would only allow one of the new phones in.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M

customer_reviews.title: Very good, despite some connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE our Ring doorbell. Installation was pretty easy and the night vision works very well. With “live mode” turned off, the battery easily lasts 2-3 months for us since we don’t live in a super busy area. I will say the recording some times has a delayed start and I’m not sure if that’s from the mediocre WiFi connection or a problem with the motion detection itself. We don’t have a huge house but the modem is in the back while the doorbell is out front, so for now we deal with that inadequate connection - not feeling like shelling out another $50 for a “WiFi extender” or what have you.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Magnuson

customer_reviews.title: Almost useless
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for a week or two. Then it started missing motion detections, Would freeze in the middle of a recording event and the middle of the event was totally lost. Had several false alarms, and some missed rings. Checked my router, internet speed, checked the installation of the ring devise and more. Did not help a bit. Adjusted the detection zones in the app (when I could even GET it to connect to my phone). Total waste of money--check out the competitors--get one that works! I now have 2 of these pieces of junk and a spare battery and money sunk into their web storage offering. All useless!
customer_reviews.author: treasure hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love ring. I just installed last week and already caught a theif trying to steal one of our cars. The graphics are great and you can talk to people through it. I'm in love and will be getting the security lightlights with camera for the side of the house.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Terrible - don't waste your money or your time
customer_reviews.text: The motion sensor is useless - mine is 10 feet from my router so that's not the problem. The motion sensor doesn't detect almost anything...maybe 1 out of a 1000 events. I just hope that a robber knows to ring the doorbell before stealing my packages, otherwise there's no way they will be caught. I spent hours setting up (had to screw it into brick/concrete since I have a brick house) then endless hours testing and configuring it - not worth my time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Cruise

customer_reviews.title: Customer Awareness
customer_reviews.text: Bought two units at full price. Found a charging cable and battery but no charging adapters in the box. Realized they don't include it with the box. Called cust support. They told me to use my phone's charging adapter. I told em I can't because it's type C whereas the ring 2 uses microUSB. I was then told to use laptop's USB port to charge. So it seems I now have to buy a laptop to charge my ring video door bell 2. Bad experience as I did not expect to buy an expensive product without all necessary supplies. Probably my fault since I failed to read all fine print instructions.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: It is definitely not plug and play. Took 3 calls to their excellent support staff to get it up and running. If your door bell is not close to your router you will have to purchase and extender and get that all signed up/in. There is a delay from the time the bell/motion is detected until you are alerted on your phone. The good thing is you get a 30 day free subscription to their cloud storage to get thing ironed out. After that you pay $30 per year. You can not record to your computer or other devise. You can see it real time but once you close it it's gone.
customer_reviews.author: R24

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK AS ADVERTISED, ACTUALLY FALSE ADVERTISING!!
customer_reviews.text: I BOUGHT 2 ECHO5's and the Ring doorbell. It takes 11 seconds for the ECHO to show who's at the door! After you say "Alexa "answer the door" WHICH MAKES IT USELESS. Very disappointed at both Amazon and Ring for their POOR customer service, because they have no FIX! It would be good if Ring showed automatically. I will be returning all 3 items!!
customer_reviews.author: John Spinosa

customer_reviews.title: Decent video, took some additional equipment to get it connected to the network.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the original Ring doorbell at the front door for close to a year and have been happy with it. I purchased this for the back of the house, but was having trouble with a weak WiFi signal. I purchased the Chime Pro hoping that would help, but it did not. Ended up buying a Netgear range extender to get it to stay connected. The video quality is better that the first one. Motion detection works well. There is much more activity on this new doorbell, and I find the battery doesn't last as long. I do like the fact that the battery is removable and I don't have to bring the whole doorbell in to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Channing Hayden III

customer_reviews.title: disappointing - I will be returning it asap
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Nice packaging design. I think the Neighborhood Watch feature could be helpful. Nightvision and wifi seem ok, but useless if the unit doesn't work. Cons: The motion detector does not work. At all. This is possibly a faulty unit but the actual doorbell video is so slow, as other reviewers have said, you'll be lucky if you get a photo of the UPS driver's back as they are walking away. Also, if you plan to use it on battery power, you'll need to remove a tiny, easily lost, screw on the bottom of the faceplate every time you remove the battery to charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: I Love this product, but it does need some improvement
customer_reviews.text: When this works - it is the BEST gadget of the year. I love being able to see who is or has been at my front door. The camera picks up a whole lot more than just the front porch. You may need to do some adjusting because when we first set it up, it would activate when a car drove by. The down-side is the connection is slow. If someone rings the doorbell - it can take a while for it to ring your phone. The battery life is not great either. And it is very slow to recharge. A back-up battery has been unavailable for order for weeks now. I'm on the waiting list.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: I can now recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm fairly pleased with this doorbell. After a short hiccough of me forgetting to disable two-factor authentication and then facing an excessive wait time from customer service, the company's customer service came through and completely changed my opinion. That is, they took the time to email me upon reading my previous poor review to further assist me with my complaint. As often it feels like the individual customer isn't important to these giant companies, I found that touching. Also, a word of advice. If you find yourself unable to access the two-factor authorization text, ask customer service to remove the device from that account and add it to a new one. That was way quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Average Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Large size, poor range, poor speaker.
customer_reviews.text: Poor range, slow alerts, monthly fees. WiFi extender probably needed. My router is 15 feet from the doorbell and it gets poor signal. Larger than you think. Think thick deck of cards plus the black part. Video quality is poor and doesn’t look HD. You can hear people really well but they can hardly hear you. The speaker isn’t particularly loud and distorts if you raise your voice so they can hear you. The motion zone on this is terrible and convoluted to set up. Either you get alerted by squirrels all day or you don’t get alerted until a person is walking away. I tried several settings without avail. Perfect for squirrel watching!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Wait Until They Perfect It
customer_reviews.text: Does not work for me. “Live View” NEVER works and video quality is not up to par. (Not 1080p) Not worth the price to me. Looking at other brands, will donate the “Ring!” When I have decided upon its replacement. FYI: I have 300mbps internet service operating on a WIFI Mesh system with a node 10’ from the Ring device! Tested 124mbs download and 22mbs upload outside measured and recorded “at the device“ as the worst of multiple speed measurements Purchased 11/18. Many false alarms and always “times-out” when attempting the “Live View” option. I must have a DUD!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Smith

customer_reviews.title: I WANT TO RETURN IT
customer_reviews.text: The "free trial" expired and now this piece of trash is useless. Of course they give you a 30 day trial and then a return period that ends at the same time so now I can't return it. I WANT MY MONEY BACK. This thing sucks anyways even when it was on the trial.
customer_reviews.author: Klassy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works great with phone and Echo Show
customer_reviews.text: The Ring is the app that makes the Echo Show worth while. The installation was easy (open the box and start charging the battery because that will take 5+ hours). Added the Device and Skill to Alexa and I was getting notifications on the phone. To access the Ring from the Show you have to configure alerts, then you can say "Alexa show me the FrontDoor" (or whatever you called the device). If you do that you can hear the person at the door but they can't hear you unless you enable the microphone. The audio quality isn't the greatest but its sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Tarbox

customer_reviews.title: Great doorbell camera system
customer_reviews.text: Just finished installing was a simple process unfortunately theres a slight gap between the angle plate they provide and the top right corner of the actual device nothing anyone would notice but the installer. The motion detection could be better I wish it wasnt done by degrees but rather degree and radius per sector. Battery life is decent so far will right back when first charge is drained.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: THIS PRODUCT STINKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had nothing but problems with this piece of crap!! I have called ring NUMEROUS TIMES over these months with no resolution to my problem. It won't record audio or video except in spurts. I get a blacked out screen when trying to see a live view. The screen freezes and blurs. This product that ring manufactures is absolute GARBAGE!!! They have sent me 1 replacement and it didn't work at all!! Customer service told me sorry no refund out of refund window. DON'T BY THIS PRODUCT. YOU WON'T GET ANY HELP FROM RING AT ALL!!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Bait and switch subscription required
customer_reviews.text: Only rarely detects motion m. I have this ring camera and a WYZE camera in the same location the ring only detects half of the motion the WYZE camera does. The WYZE camera being only 20$ and having all the features the ring does and more with NO SUBSCRIPTION TO USE. That’s right ring has a subscription to view the recorded footage. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: I had such high hopes
customer_reviews.text: The best thing I can say about it the salt and planning that went into the packaging and installation kit. Wow they really did think of everything . Second best thing I can say about it is that it does ring my existing doorbell chime and the battery stays 100% charged by hooking it to my existing doorbell wiring. I had such high hopes for this camera doorbell but it leaves a lot to be desired. Notifications are slow and audio communication is poor. I'm not sure if I'm going to sign up for the cloud recording service due to these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jtfairhope

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I've been hearing about this product for years and i thought by now it would've been out long enough that it was really good. Nope- i will get notifications all day about cars passing or light/sun reflecting off of something but i wont get notifications when a delivery person walks right up to my door , no matter how many times i adjust motion detection. The other day when i was getting home i saw the delivery guy walk up and pushed the doorbell on this thing and maybe he didn't push hard enough but i didn't get motion sensor notification either. soooo...? Keep searching, this cam ain't it.
customer_reviews.author: irene

customer_reviews.title: Video Quality is Great...if you can live with the delays...
customer_reviews.text: The Video quality is real HD. However, the record processing is way too long. After receiving motion alert, you have to wait couple minutes before you will be able to see what it is about, since the video processing takes number of minutes. Only after awhile, you can view what or who has triggered this alert. The same happens after somebody rang the bell. It is impossible to answer the bell instantly, but only after the device activated during a minute or two. This is great disappointment. If I could, I would return this device and tried the other type...
customer_reviews.author: Leonid Mann

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD QUALITY JUNK
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of crap. After having this thing just over a year it will not stop sensing motion. Even after covering the camera with duct tape. It keeps alerting motion when there is absolutely nothing there. Do not purchase this thing if you want sanity! It will drive you nuts with false alarms. Even before this latest issue it would detect vehicles on the street but not people on the porch! Adjusted the motion sensitivity numerous times. It's just not worth the money or aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H

customer_reviews.title: Great for package delivery or seeing who’s at the door
customer_reviews.text: We installed this because we live in a city where package theft is a big problem. We can monitor even when we aren’t home or if a delivery person doesn’t ring the bell to know when something is left on our stoop. Also, it’s good to see who is at the door if you’re home alone. I like the safety aspect it provides and the recording. I bought an extra battery because we live in a northern climate so the battery needs to be recharged more often. But you can monitor how much juice the battery has so you know when to swap them out.
customer_reviews.author: Real feedback

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as well as it should. There are better options out there.
customer_reviews.text: The camera does not work well. It takes too long to be able to review footage after I have an alert or someone rings the door bell. It’s very spotty and not reliable. I much prefer my old Nest Camera and the ease of use. There are many times the camera will not record a delivery or a person at my door and other times it will record a car driving by when I have the settings set to ignore cars on the street. Overall I am not happy with the way the camera works. Needs to be improved.
customer_reviews.author: C8992

customer_reviews.title: Works great good product
customer_reviews.text: This video door bell has been a great addition to our home security system. Video quality is very good. Sometimes there is a delay accessing the doorbell live view however, I think that is more of a wifi issue. Only complaints about the product are 1) Battery Life and 2) Paying the monthly fee for playback. Since we have the system setup to record based on motion the battery needs to be recharged monthly. Regarding the fee, I don't think customers should have to pay a monthly fee to keep recordings.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: I've never had so much benefit from one device and service.
customer_reviews.text: Best money I've spend in my entire life, hands down. The motion trigger has been catching my neighbor's gossip about me as she walks past my door in our apartment complex and I may have legal grounds, harassment as she's been making false reports to management, also verified via Ring. I am so much more informed now.
customer_reviews.author: gender8ombs

customer_reviews.title: Very Detailed Video Footage!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our son and daughter in law for Christmas and they love it! They installed it very easily and the same night, there was someone out in the street yelling and 2 others chasing him. He was acting irrationally and the Ring captured a very detailed and clear video of the entire scene. The police came and eventually caught him running through backyards and were able to identify him correctly due to the clear video our son had. Great product, price and we highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: MR58

customer_reviews.title: Now works great! See update.
customer_reviews.text: ●Delay in notification by several seconds with strong wifi. For example, my daughter walked up, took several seconds to unlock both locks, walked in and was standing in front of me when I was notified of "motion at the front door". ●App is bugged and several times a day will not connect despite giving a "Clean bill of health" on diagnostic. Would not have purchased after trying it for a month. *Update After my initial review the executive of community support from RING reached out to me and guided me in some tweaks to improve my service. After several weeks things have been absolutely constant and I'm very happy with my purchase and this product. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Alcyon911

customer_reviews.title: Nice little security for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted a little peace of mind when at home or away and the ring doorbell definitely fit the bill!! Replaced it where I had an existing doorbell and hardwired it so battery should not be an issue. Used the angled mount as it gave the best view of my porch and front yard. Installation was pretty easy and it looks nice. Has worked ever since it was installed with only one miss on a package that was delivered. Have no idea why it didn’t record it. I will probably continue with the $3 monthly storage once the free period is over. It was a today’s deal which included a free Echo dot. Happy with this purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Just love this product
customer_reviews.text: Updated review: I had a customer service rep call me and he walked me through the steps of connecting my ring 2 and he was able to figure out why my ring 2 was not syncing with my echo show it was sooo easy one minor mix up caused the ring from not connecting to my echo show, I’ve read other reviews about not syncing up and my advise is if you’ve tried everything I would highly suggest contacting amazon customer service they are super friendly and helpful (the call was less then 15 minutes) and I’m sooo glad I did....now my ring works and I love asking alexia show me front door after I get notified of motion outside....
customer_reviews.author: Sophie 723

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this doorbell and a Chime about a year ago for a second, seasonal home in another state. As a doorbell it works great. However, twice this year it has become somehow “disconnected” from the WiFi in the house (which I can confirm is working). Last time it was unavailable remotely for a couple of weeks (video or live), then “magically” reconnected on its own. It has now been disconnected again for at least two weeks and all the while WiFi keeps working. Company says there is nothing they can do if I am not next to the device. Helpful. Kind of defeats the “remote” access benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend. The app doesn’t open immediately following a ring. Motion detection alerts are at least 8-10 seconds behind-that’s a lifetime in terms of someone walking onto your property. People make it to my door before I even I know they’re on my property. I’ve called three times and they told me to download “rapid ring” because apparently they can’t fix the freezing issue with the original app. It’s just a mess all around. Wish I had gone with another company.
customer_reviews.author: Nihala M.

customer_reviews.title: Warning, you'll pay for life.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay but the night vision is not very good however the worst thing is that you have to have a paid subscription to save your pics & videos. That's a deal-breaker. I wish I would have done more diligent research reading the reviews because I would not have bought it.
customer_reviews.author: A Jax

customer_reviews.title: Love the ring 2 doorbell, zero complaints so far.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this Doorbell. Installation is a breeze, and everything is very intuitive. The motion detector is configured perfectly for my house. I live in a court - sort of... but the cars driving by dont activate the motion detector like I was afraid of. It only goes off if a car pulls in my drive way, or someone walks onto my porch. Tied in with an echo show (I have the 5, but wish I would've got atleast the 8") and this is such an awesome feature to be able to ask alexa to "show me my front door" and it pops right up! Couldnt be happier.
customer_reviews.author: George McFall

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Be aware that when you buy the doorbell by itself for 200 dollars, you can't hear the ring without being right by your phone. So, you need to buy Chime Pro as well. Although all of the other devices can pick up my wifi just fine, neither of the Ring doorbells can and have a very poor signal, even after I poured more money into this nonsense by buying the Ring chimes that have wifi boosters. ugh - very unhappy. Once someone rings the door bell, the chime may or may not actually ring to let me know someone is at the door. If it does ring, it is only after a long delay. ):
customer_reviews.author: Nora Lynn Gussman

customer_reviews.title: This is not a reliable security system.
customer_reviews.text: I have had problems with my Ring system since day one. I have made contact with your help desk, received temporary fixes, but no pendant fix. I don't think your product can perform as advised. Reviews on the internet seem to agree with this assumption. I'm alerted to motion between thirty seconds to several minutes after the fact. Not hardly acceptable...
customer_reviews.author: DC Steinman

customer_reviews.title: WIFI A BIG ISSUE.
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept. It looks good and was easy to install. That being said, the WiFi is terrible. It’s mounted on the other side of a wood framed wall with bunk siding from my wireless router. Less than 4 feet away (not an exaggeration). It’s plagued with constant buffering and connectivity issues. I purchased a Ring Chime with the WiFi extender... absolutely no improvement and that’s mounted 5 feet from my router and three feet and one exterior wall away from the doorbell. I have wireless devices in my basement on the far opposite end of the house that connect perfectly. This has got to be a design/technology issue. The WiFi is all that holds it back.
customer_reviews.author: J287B153

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera View
customer_reviews.text: This Ring Doorbell easily replaced our standard existing doorbell. You have the option to install wirelessly or wired, but my husband hardwired it to our existing doorbell wires and it works perfectly. We live in a cul-de-sac and the camera view shows the whole cul-de-sac. The motion sensor has about a two second delay, but not much to worry about since able to scroll back to review anything you may have missed seeing. I was torn between this one and the Nest, but I am so glad I chose the Ring. It cost less and has excellent quality. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Reena Patrick

product_meta.title: Ring Video Doorbell 2 with HD Video, Motion Activated Alerts, Easy Installation
feature_bullets: 1080p HD video doorbell that lets you see, hear and speak to people from your phone, tablet, or select Echo device. Includes privacy features, such as customizable privacy zones and audio privacy, to focus only on what's relevant to you.
Get notifications whenever motion is detected by adjusting your motion zones.
With Live View, you can check in on your home any time through the Ring app.
Easily setup your Ring Video Doorbell 2 by connecting to wifi via the Ring app and mounting in your desired location.
Powered by a quick-release rechargeable battery pack or connects to existing doorbell wiring.
Record all your videos, review what you missed for up to 60 days, and share videos and photos for $3/month per device with a Ring Protect Plan.

Connect your Ring doorbell with Alexa to hear announcements on your compatible Echo device when your doorbell is pressed and see a live view of your camera if you have an Echo device with a screen. Talk to visitors by saying “Alexa, talk to the front door.”
